data.title: Beat the Heat with 18 Cool Things to Do Indoors in San Antonio
data.meta_description: Discover what to do indoors in San Antonio this summer! Explore 18 air-conditioned attractions near the Emily Morgan Hotel, from museums to entertainment. Stay cool and have fun!
data.text:
Beat the Heat with 18 Cool Indoor Activities in San Antonio You Can’t Miss

As the Texas sun blazes and temperatures soar, San Antonio transforms into a sizzling urban oasis, making some of the city’s best outdoor activities more challenging. But fear not, intrepid traveler! The Alamo City has a secret weapon against the summer heat – a treasure trove of air-conditioned attractions that promise cool adventures and unforgettable experiences. Whether you’re a history buff, art enthusiast, foodie, or family looking for fun, San Antonio’s indoor scene has something for everyone.

From time-traveling through Texas history to indulging in refreshing libations, from family-friendly adventures to sophisticated evening entertainment, we’ve got your indoor itinerary covered. So, grab a cold drink, settle into that comfy hotel armchair, and let’s dive into the best indoor activities San Antonio has to offer

Table of Contents

Step into History: Air-Conditioned Time Travel in San Antonio

The Alamo

Just a short walk from The Emily Morgan Hotel, the Alamo stands as a testament to Texas’ revolutionary spirit. Step inside this hallowed mission-turned-fortress and feel the temperature drop as you’re transported back to 1836. Engaging exhibits and knowledgeable guides bring the siege of the Alamo to life, while the air conditioning keeps you comfortable as you explore this cornerstone of Texas history.

Buckhorn Saloon & Museum

For a uniquely Texan experience, mosey on over to the Buckhorn Saloon & Museum. This eclectic attraction houses an impressive array of wildlife exhibits, Texas Ranger artifacts, and a replica of a turn-of-the-century saloon. As you wander through the cool, dimly lit halls, you’ll encounter everything from a two-headed calf to a chair made of horns. It’s a delightfully odd slice of Texas lore that’s sure to leave you with plenty of stories to tell.

Spanish Governor's Palace

Step back into 18th-century Spanish colonial life at the Spanish Governor’s Palace. Despite its grand name, this modest adobe structure served as the official residence and working office for the captains of the Spanish military garrison from 1722 to the early 1800s. As you explore the cool interior, you’ll discover period furnishings, beautiful colonial artifacts, and a charming central courtyard with a gurgling fountain. The palace offers a fascinating glimpse into San Antonio’s colonial past, with informative exhibits detailing the daily lives of early settlers and the political climate of the time. Its air-conditioned rooms provide a welcome respite from the summer heat, allowing you to immerse yourself in history in comfort. Located in the heart of downtown, just a short walk from The Emily Morgan Hotel, the Spanish Governor’s Palace is a must-visit for history enthusiasts looking to understand San Antonio’s rich colonial heritage.

San Antonio Museum of Art

Housed in the historic Lone Star Brewery complex, the San Antonio Museum of Art offers a cool respite filled with artistic wonders from around the world. From ancient Mediterranean treasures to contemporary American masterpieces, the museum’s diverse collections span 5,000 years of human creativity. The industrial-chic interior provides a striking backdrop for the artwork, while state-of-the-art climate control ensures your comfort as you lose yourself in the beauty of human expression.

McNay Art Museum

For a more intimate art experience, head to the McNay Art Museum. Set in a stunning Spanish Colonial Revival mansion, this museum boasts an impressive collection of 19th and 20th-century art. As you wander through the cool, elegant galleries, you’ll encounter works by masters like Picasso, O’Keeffe, and Hopper. The museum’s architecture is a work of art in itself, with beautiful courtyards and fountains that offer moments of tranquil reflection between galleries.

Hopscotch: An Immersive Art Experience

Escape the heat and dive into a world of creativity at Hopscotch, San Antonio’s innovative immersive art gallery. This 20,000 square-foot space houses 15 large-scale, interactive installations created by over 40 local, national, and international artists. Hopscotch offers a unique blend of art, technology, and imagination, inviting visitors to engage with exhibits like the “Rainbow Cave,” “Laser Graffiti,” and “VJ Yourself.” The gallery also features a bar serving specialty cocktails inspired by the exhibitions, and a gift shop offering unique, locally-crafted items. Open six days a week (closed on Tuesdays), Hopscotch provides a cool, creative escape for art enthusiasts of all ages. With its commitment to community engagement and support for various social initiatives, Hopscotch offers more than just an art experience – it’s a cultural journey in the heart of San Antonio.

Kids' Paradise: Where Little Explorers Stay Cool and Curious

The DoSeum

When it comes to indoor activities for families in San Antonio, The DoSeum tops the list. This cutting-edge children’s museum is a paradise of hands-on learning experiences. From a state-of-the-art robot lab to a miniature version of San Antonio’s river system, The DoSeum’s exhibits encourage children to explore, create, and discover. The spacious, air-conditioned facility ensures that young minds stay engaged and bodies stay cool, even on the hottest summer days.

San Antonio Aquarium

Dive into a world of aquatic wonder at the San Antonio Aquarium. This family-friendly attraction offers close encounters with marine life from around the globe, all within the comfort of a climate-controlled environment. Kids can touch stingrays, feed lorikeets, and even see mermaids swim by in the tropical lagoon. With interactive exhibits and daily shows, the aquarium provides hours of educational entertainment that will leave your little ones fascinated and refreshed.

Ripley's Believe It or Not! Odditorium

For families who love the bizarre and extraordinary, Ripley’s Believe It or Not! Odditorium is a must-visit destination. This peculiar museum houses a collection of weird artifacts, mind-bending illusions, and interactive exhibits that will captivate visitors of all ages. From a two-headed calf to a miniature replica of the Alamo made from matchsticks, every turn reveals a new wonder. The air-conditioned galleries provide a cool backdrop for these hot topics of conversation.

LEGOLAND® Discovery Center San Antonio

For families looking to escape the heat while unleashing their creativity, LEGOLAND® Discovery Center San Antonio is the perfect destination. Located in the Shops at Rivercenter, just a short walk from The Emily Morgan Hotel, this indoor attraction is a paradise for LEGO enthusiasts of all ages. The center features a variety of hands-on play areas, building zones, and interactive rides that will keep kids (and kids at heart) entertained for hours.

Don’t miss the impressive MINILAND®, where you can marvel at San Antonio’s iconic landmarks recreated in meticulous detail using over 1.5 million LEGO bricks. Join a Master Model Builder workshop to learn expert building techniques, or let your imagination run wild in the free-build areas. With its comfortable, air-conditioned environment, LEGOLAND® Discovery Center offers a cool respite from the Texas sun while providing an engaging, educational experience that celebrates creativity and innovation. It’s an ideal indoor activity for families looking to add some colorful, brick-built fun to their San Antonio adventure.

Natural Bridge Caverns

While technically not in San Antonio proper, Natural Bridge Caverns offers a uniquely cool adventure just a short drive from the city. Located about 30 minutes northeast of downtown, this natural wonder provides a perfect escape from the summer heat. As you descend into the caverns, you’ll find yourself enveloped in a constant, comfortable 70-degree environment—nature’s own air conditioning. The caverns feature stunning formations of stalactites, stalagmites, flowstones, and chandeliers that have been slowly crafted by nature over millions of years.

Guided tours take you through illuminated passages, revealing the cave’s hidden treasures and sharing fascinating geological insights. For the more adventurous, the caverns offer special tours like the off-trail Adventure Tour or the thrilling Hidden Passages Tour. Above ground, you’ll find additional attractions like a ropes course and zip line, but the real draw is the cool, subterranean world below.

Natural Bridge Caverns provides a refreshing change of pace from urban attractions, offering visitors a chance to explore the underground wonders of Texas while beating the heat in a truly spectacular setting.

Sip, Savor, and Chill: San Antonio's Indoor Drinkable Delights

Re:Rooted 210 Urban Winery

Experience the flavors of Texas wine without leaving downtown at Re:Rooted 210 Urban Winery. This chic, air-conditioned tasting room offers a curated selection of wines produced from Texas-grown grapes. Knowledgeable staff guide you through tastings, explaining the unique characteristics of each varietal. It’s the perfect way to cool down and unwind after a day of exploring San Antonio’s indoor attractions.

Ranger Creek Brewing & Distilling

For those who prefer their libations a bit stronger, Ranger Creek Brewing & Distilling offers tours and tastings of their “brewstillery” – a unique facility that produces both craft beer and whiskey. The air-conditioned tasting room provides a comfortable setting to sample their award-winning creations while learning about the brewing and distilling processes. It’s a spirited way to beat the heat and experience San Antonio’s burgeoning craft beverage scene.

Lights, Camera, Action: San Antonio's Indoor Entertainment Scene

The Majestic Theatre

Step into the opulent Majestic Theatre and feel the temperature drop as you’re transported to a bygone era of theatrical grandeur. This restored 1929 movie palace now hosts Broadway shows, concerts, and comedy acts in its lavishly decorated auditorium. The state-of-the-art cooling system ensures your comfort as you lose yourself in world-class performances. It’s a night out that combines entertainment with a dash of San Antonio history.

Chicken N Pickle

For a unique blend of recreation and dining, head to Chicken N Pickle. This indoor-outdoor entertainment complex features air-conditioned pickleball courts, providing a fun way to stay active while beating the heat. After working up an appetite on the courts, enjoy a meal in the climate-controlled restaurant. With its combination of sports, food, and comfortable temperatures, Chicken N Pickle offers a refreshing twist on the typical night out.

River Walk Boat Tours

While technically not entirely indoors, the River Walk’s boat tours offer a refreshing way to see the city without braving the sidewalk heat. Many of the boats are covered, providing shade even during daytime tours. As you glide along the river, you’ll enjoy a cool breeze and learn about San Antonio’s history and architecture from knowledgeable guides. It’s a perfect blend of outdoor scenery and indoor comfort.

Retail Therapy and Spa Serenity: The Ultimate Indoor Indulgences

Rivercenter Mall

When the summer heat drives you indoors, head to the Rivercenter Mall for some retail therapy. This vast, air-conditioned space houses a mix of popular brands and local boutiques, ensuring hours of cool browsing and shopping. With its central location near The Emily Morgan Hotel, it’s easy to drop off your purchases and head back out for more San Antonio adventures.

Dasa Spa

When the summer heat has you seeking ultimate relaxation, look no further than Dasa Spa, rated the #1 spa in San Antonio on TripAdvisor. This urban oasis offers a cool retreat from the bustling city streets. Dasa Spa specializes in a range of rejuvenating treatments, from expert massage therapy and indulgent body treatments to revitalizing facials. Their team of skilled therapists is known for their professionalism and ability to tailor treatments to individual needs, ensuring a personalized experience that leaves you feeling refreshed and renewed. Whether you’re looking to unwind after a day of sightseeing or preparing for a special event, Dasa Spa’s tranquil atmosphere and results-oriented treatments offer the perfect escape from the Texas heat.

Your Cool San Antonio Adventure Awaits

As you can see, San Antonio offers a wealth of indoor activities that promise to keep you entertained, educated, and comfortably cool during the hot summer months. From the historic halls of the Alamo to the cutting-edge exhibits of The DoSeum, from the artistic treasures of the McNay to the refreshing delights of Ranger Creek Brewing & Distilling, there’s no shortage of air-conditioned adventures waiting for you in the Alamo City.

And what better place to base your indoor explorations than The Emily Morgan Hotel? Our prime downtown location puts you within easy reach of all these fantastic attractions. After a day of indoor adventures, return to our cool, comfortable rooms for a refreshing night’s sleep before embarking on another day of discovery.

Ready to experience the best of indoor San Antonio? Book your stay at The Emily Morgan Hotel today! Our friendly staff is standing by to help you plan your perfect, heat-beating getaway. Call us at 800-824-6674 to reserve your room and start planning your cool San Antonio adventure. Don’t let the summer heat keep you away – discover the indoor wonders of San Antonio from the comfort of The Emily Morgan Hotel!
